intro: Boivinella kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro lily, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, showy white or pale blue flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in montane grasslands and forest margins. Its leaves are broad and grass-like, and it is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Boivinella kilimandscharica plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
